name: PHP CS Fixer
description: Automatically format PHP files using php-cs-fixer with HTML, Blade and Twig support.

children.title: PHP path
children.description: path to your PHP installation, leave empty to use the default OS PHP installation.

children.title: PHP CS Fixer path
children.description: path to your fixer executable, if empty the fixer included with the extension will be used.

children.title: Fixer Dedicated server Port
children.description: If using a dedicated server to fix the files, you can adjust the server port here.

children.title: PHP dedicated server
children.description: Starting PHP can be a little slow, having a small server will speed up formatting

children.title: Show logs
children.description: Only for debug and in case the extenstion does not work correctly

children.title: Enable PHP CS Fixer 3 (You might need restart)
children.description: V2 is no longer maintained, if you have a custom configuration file you need to check the upgrade guide to make sure V3 works with your configuration. If you don't have a custom configuration you can enable this option without problems. V2 will be removed in the near future. Click the icon at the right to learn how to upgrade your config file. This option does not work if you've configured a custom PHP CS Fixer path.

children.title: Coding Standard
children.description: Select the coding standard, you can apply additional rules below.

children.title: Additional Fixer Rules
children.description: One per line. Define additional rules you want to apply. Please read the docs for more information.

children.title: Global config path
children.description: Instead of defining rules you can use a global .php_cs or .php_cs.dist or .php-cs-fixer.php or .php-cs-fixer.dist.php file for all the projects, if you add a .php_cs in the root of your project it will be used instead of the global configuration. The rules above will be ignored if the configuration file is used.

children.title: Format on save
children.description: Enable to automatically format on file save

children.title: Format on save only if workspace has a config file
children.description: Only format on save if the workspace contains a configuration file for example: .php_cs or .php_cs.dist or .php-cs-fixer.php or .php-cs-fixer.dist.php. You can still format the file doing right click in the code and choose Format with PHP CS Fixer

children.title: Ignore remote files
children.description: Ignore format on save for remote files

children.title: Respect Nova's preferences for PHP indentation
children.description: If enabled, the formatter will use Nova's tab width and indentetation style which also adds supoprt for .editorconfig. If you prefer you can define the tab width and style below

children.title: Use tabs
children.description: Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces.

children.title: Tab width
children.description: Specify the number of spaces per indentation-level.

children.title: Format HTML in PHP files
children.description: Enable this box to try to fix HTML in PHP files

children.title: Apply Additional fixes
children.description: Enable this box to apply aditional fixes to HTML/PHP files

children.title: HTML Rules
children.description: Additional rules you want to apply when formatting HTML inside a PHP file. (one per line)

children.description: Enable this box to format Blade files on save
